page.title: 09AMENITIES AT BEAFORD
page.content: Being a small country village, amenities for the public are rather limited. There is a Post Office Stores, with nearby telephone box; one public house, the Globe; a fine village hall; a garage; a church; a chapel; a village green; a primary school; and a farm shop a mile from the village. Much use is made of the hall by village organisations for meetings, local events and clubs. Bus services are limited. There is a weekday service to Exeter, once each day and return; twice a week to Torrington and Bideford. Most households depend on their own cars for shopping excursions to Torrington, Bideford or Barnstaple, where supermarkets and discount stores are available. These towns also provide the nearest leisure activities.
